verses.text: Now the Philistines fought against Israel; and the men of Israel fled before the Philistines and fell slain on Mount Gilboa.
verses.comment: Faithful to Hebrew text; 'Mount Gilboa' per original.

verses.text: And the Philistines overtook Saul and his sons, and the Philistines struck down Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchishua, Saulâ€™s sons.
The battle pressed hard against Saul, and the archers found him; and he was badly wounded by the archers.
verses.comment: Literally, 'the archers hit him'; English clarified 'badly wounded.'

verses.text: Then Saul said to his armor-bearer, 'Draw your sword and thrust me through with it, so that these uncircumcised may not come and stab me and abuse me.' But his armor-bearer would not, for he was very afraid. So Saul took his own sword and fell on it.
verses.comment: Retains direct language; 'abuse' translates Hebrew 'deal shamefully with.'

verses.text: And when his armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he also fell on his sword and died with him.
So Saul died, and his three sons, and his armor-bearer, and all his men, together, on that day.
verses.comment: Order and wording are literal; 'all his men' per Hebrew 'all his men.'

verses.text: And when the men of Israel who were on the other side of the valley and those who were beyond the Jordan saw that the men of Israel had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their cities and fled; and the Philistines came and lived in them.
verses.comment: Rendered 'the other side of the valley' per the Hebrew.

verses.text: The next day, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, they found Saul and his three sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
They cut off his head, and stripped him of his armor, and sent messengers throughout the land of the Philistines, to proclaim the news in the house of their idols and among the people.
verses.comment: 'House of their idols' reflects plural in Hebrew, not just 'house of their gods.'

verses.text: And they put his armor in the house of the Ashtaroth, and they fastened his body to the wall of Beth-shan.
verses.comment: 'House of the Ashtaroth' retains plural form from Hebrew.

verses.text: When the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead heard what the Philistines had done to Saul,
verses.comment: Name 'Jabesh-gilead' as per standard; sentence structure from Hebrew.

verses.text: all the valiant men rose and went all night, and took the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons from the wall of Beth-shan, and came to Jabesh and burned them there.
verses.comment: Retains phrase 'the valiant men'; Hebrew 'burned them.'

verses.text: They took their bones and buried them under the tamarisk tree at Jabesh, and fasted seven days.
verses.comment: 'Tamarisk tree' per Hebrew, not altered; fasting period per Hebrew text.
